results.title: Indonesia
results.creator_credit: Arch Nicholson, John Temple, University of Queensland Press, Film Australia and ABC
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Asian insight”.
What makes this diverse chain of islands into a nation? Indonesia’s national motto “Unity in diversity” is the film’s starting point in its concentration on Sumatra, Java and Bali - the most populated areas. One of the most interesting sequences is an examination of the Indonesian concept of power - that there is a finite amount of it in the world. Another highlight is the Indonesian Army and its role as an essential ingredient in society - not, as so often in the West, as something appended to, or imposed on, society.

results.title: Thailand
results.creator_credit: Arch Nicholson, Roan Hannam, Don Murray, John Temple, University of Queensland, Film Australia and ABC
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Asian insight”
A look at the historical and cultural background of Thailand. Focuses on the respect the Thais have for the monks and their religion, and the veneration of the monarchy.

results.title: Hong Kong, Singapore: fragrant harbour, lion city
results.creator_credit: Arch Nicholson, John Temple, Queensland University of Technology, Film Australia and ABC
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Asian insight”.
A look at the cultural background of Hong Kong and Singapore. Both places are governed by the professional elite ruling class. However, they have produced very different societies under the pressure of history and circumstances. Sujitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Arid Landforms
results.media_note: Sorry, we don't have images or video for this item.

results.title: Ayers Rock
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Arid Landforms”.
Gives examples of Australian landforms resulting from weathering and erosion in arid regions. Illustrates examples of weathering and erosion responsible for producing the features seen in Ayers Rock. Shows three types of residuals found in arid Central Australia, kinds of weathering responsible for the formation of Ayers Rock and emphasises geological time periods. Also notes in detail the caves, grooves and guttering, and the under-cut base caused by running water. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Devil's Marbles and the Olgas
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Arid Landforms”.
The film provides a geological background to residuals in an arid landscape. It shows the influence of jointing and physical and chemical weathering on rocks. Particularly stressed are spheroidal weathering, freeze-thaw, coalescing alluvial fans and the influence of vegetation on rocks.

results.title: Mesas and gibber plains
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Arid Landforms”.
Gives examples of some Australian landforms resulting from weathering and erosion in arid regions, and discusses the formation of mesas and gibber plains. Animated diagrams illustrate formations. The importance of water erosion in arid regions is stressed.

results.title: Measure of care: Alligator Rivers region
results.creator_credit: David Roberts, Don Murray and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Alligator Rivers Region”.
Following an environmental impact study by Mr Justice Fox, the Australian Government set up the Office of the Supervising Scientist to carry out scientific research in the Alligator River region of Kakadu National Park to establish base-line figures which would enable scientists to monitor the mining activities. This documentary deals in some detail with this research, and discusses the problems associated with mining in such an unusual and beautiful part of Kakadu National Park. Narrated by Robyn Williams.

group_siblings.title: Impact of mining
group_siblings.creator_credit: David Roberts, Don Murray and Film Australia

results.title: Impact of mining
results.creator_credit: David Roberts, Don Murray and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Alligator Rivers Region”.
The second film in a series looking at the work of the Supervising Scientist following the Fox Report on Uranium mining in the Kakadu National Park region of the Northern Territory. To monitor possible problems, scientific studies were carried out before work began. Shows some of the field work and by the use of interviews examines possible problems which could occur.
